moves.1. e4 e6 2. d4 d5 3. Nc3 Bb4 4. e5 c5: A reasonable move, putting pressure on my centre and getting room for his queenside knight
moves.5... Bxc3+ 6. bxc3 cxd4: This capture is probably not best. Nc6 or Ne7 (preparing to castle on the kingside, which might not be a good idea) seems better
moves.7. cxd4 Nc6 8. Nf3: I'd like to play f4, but protecting my d pawn is more important
moves.8... Qb6 9. Be3 Nge7 10. Bd3 O-O 11. O-O: Opening up the position for my bishops
moves.12... Qc7 13. Rb1: Although it would have been stronger if it had attacked the black Queen, Rb1 is still a useful move, because I make b7-b5 difficult to prepare
moves.13... h6: This is probably too weakening, when I have a light-squared bishop and his isn't in the game yet
moves.14... Bd7: Nf5 ?! might be better, Bd7 does nothing for his position
moves.15. Bxh6 gxh6 16. Qxh6: Now Nf5 doesn't work (even if it did before)
moves.16... Nf5 17. Bxf5 exf5 18. Ng5: And I have forced checkmate, unless he wants to try f6 ?
